Name: Escaping Home: A Novel (The Survivalist Series)

ReviewList.Text: The first two books had so much promise....excitement, fast paced action, & suspense. "Escaping Home", the third book in the series, had me scanning over more than a few pages just trying to get to the action. By the time I was halfway through, I would've welcomed any kind of action: maybe a raccoon invading a garbage can or a deer running in front of one of their vehicles, anything. Seriously, I would have welcomed either of those scenarios just to break up the page after page monotony that is this book. I hate to say it after how much I enjoyed the first two books but "Escaping Home" is a "snore fest". I'll probably buy the next book in the series but if things don't speed up, that will be it for me. I gave this one 2 stars simply because I enjoyed the first two in the series, otherwise, it would've only gotten 1 star.

Morgan and his family were smart enough to prepare for the unexpected.  They built up a good back-up food supply, solar power to run the essentials, water supply, etc. It was enough for a while, but throw in some Feds that never heard of the constitution, a few jealous ex-neighbors and a firestorm erupts.  This is the story of a bug out after the fight gets personal.  Sarge and his men are a big part of the story, along with the hardware they brought to the party.  There is a lot of action and various sub-plots to keep the pages turning.  On another level, for anyone who has done any prepping or has plans to, the book does deliver a lot or realism and food for thought.  Overall, its a good story in the larger saga of the survival of Morgan and his family and friends.  It does leave some cliffhangers, though and the bigger action and whatever payback is coming will need to wait for the author to write the next installment.

I have been reading some of the independent writers here and I expect a few type and grammar errors now and then.  Low budget by necessity.  Proofreading can be tough to get done I imagine. While the story continues here, annoyingly the grammar and type errors have multiplied.  A lot!  I found at least one every other page or so. Much shorter book than the previous 2 and much of it seemed like filler merely to expand the word count.  Honestly, I enjoyed the first 2 much better.  Is this what happens when an independent writer gets under contract? Seems like my 3rd grader proofread it.  This one also ends as a major cliff hanger without any real interim resolution to any main story lines like the other 2 books.  Read an article indicating A. American is contracted for 5 in the series.  Undecided if I will read the forthcoming last 2. I gave 4 stars each to the first 2.  Too bad.

Loved the first book, second was good, this one is soso. Very little action and a lot of talk. Sad to say the author is doing a a "milk run" playing on the success of the first 2 books. I read only Kindle books, 1st book had 5869 "locations" (think pages but not) 2nd book had 6963 locations, this book has only 3687 locations and ends abruptly "forcing" you to buy the next book if you don't abandon the series like me! To the author, sorry but I calls em how I sees them and I feel you owe everyone a free "next" book.
Unlike the first two books in this series, escaping home just makes you want to escape the book. Slow, boring, tedious and pointless. Read one and two, skip this one all together.

Going home is probably one of my all time favorite books, this one not so much.  Ive started to notice a trend, where these amazon authors come out with a book that they have obviously spent a lot of time and energy thinking about and writing about, have a huge hit successful book and then come out with some garbage to hurry up and cash in on (and more power to ya brother).  This one needed more time to marinate.  I wish you and your family well Mr. A, and Go Noles!!!

the first two books were a " can't put it down type " but this one is a sleeper.  very bad ending, it seems that someone else wrote it that had no idea of how to end a book, even for a series type  .  sorry but i can only give this one a two star.

The first two books were pretty good.  This one wandered with no real complete storyline.  It ends with no real cliff hanger that would inspire you to buy the next book.  It just ends abruptly with no real...."stay tuned folks"  Very amateur planning!

This must be the last book in the series, because he spent most of it dawdling around.  It was like a writing assignment in which he was supposed to describe things, not have any action, or promote the story line.  I won't waste my time or money on any more books by this author.
A whole lot more talking and a whole lot less action. It's just a lot more unnecessary talking in this one, but still a good book.
Love the series!  I downloaded this morning and just finished. I can see more thought by the author in each book. Also, his writing ability and story telling continue to improve.
excellent continuation of the series. Lots of good action and suspense. Was a quick read but absolutely worth it for the cost. Good work A American. Got me already waiting on edge for the next book.

I enjoyed this book and see that the author is greatly improved not only in their writing, but also in the storytelling. That being said I didn't give this four stars because I feel strongly that a story should have a beginning, middle and an end (even when it is part of a trilogy or decology.) This is only middle...

I'm enjoying this series . Lots of survivalist  information . I enjoy the sarge and his boys more than Morgan and his spoiled family. I feel like people would do better than this. But it is an interesting story.
I liked the book and glad I read it. Looking forward to the next one. Seems like the author maybe rushed this one a bit though.

I had been looking forward to this release and when I started it I ended up finishing it in one sitting. The story line is gripping and contains something for everyone. While yes the scenario described is an exaggeration of some of the attitudes and practices of certain organizations it does contain some kernels of disturbing truth. I also really like how the civilians in the book want to remain civilians and just be left to live in peace. Too many stories like this feature the theme of a normal citizen who ends up becoming a soldier by default and then their life centers around that. The guys in this series are willing to fight when pushed or when it becomes necessary, but their focus remains being able to care for their families and they try to leave the fighting to the soldiers who are on their side. Can't wait for the next installment.
Love this book series!  Can't wait to see what happens next.  Let's hope the good guys always win.  Go Army!!!

I was very excite about these three books. My wife bought them for ma as a Christmas gift. I started reading and found them to be a great story, but the filth in the use of the F-word and all the other four letter words were not called for. Some reads might not mind hearing and reading vulgarity and profanity, but I would rather enjoy a truly talented writer who could use better descriptive words, than the GHETTO words found so quickly in these books, will be returning all three for a refund.

I almost didn't buy the third book because of the reviews. Now I'm glad I did. Maybe I'm boring but I liked learning about day to day stuff. I always wonder after the action how do people make it work when the food runs out or their small amount of technology is gone. I really love this series. I gave it 4 instead of 5 because as others have said it does just stop all of a sudden. Thankfully I found this series after book four was published. I'm going to be sad when this series finally ends.
I have read some of the other reviews about this series. People need to remember that these books are just fiction. Waiting on the next installment.
Really enjoyed reading this third book. Looking forward to the next one. Love all of the characters especially Sarge and Jess.

The first two books in the series were action packed & entertaining - good reading if you're into this genre.  Because of that experience, I bought book 3 as soon as it came out.  Unfortunately, it was a fizzle for me.  This one feels 'phoned in' - doesn't really move anything forward in character development or plot.
Kept me on the edge of my seat. I couldn't stop reading it. I also found it helpful with some of my prepping needs. Can't wait for the next book to come out.

I have read all three of his books in this series can not put them down.  They are so real in the sense that this could really happen to all of us the way the government and economy is going so with that said read HEADLINE!!!!!!!!!!!
Really enjoyed the book, loving the series. Can't wait for the next one! Really makes you think about things differently for sure.
Couldn't put it down! Can't wait  for next book to come out in June. I pre-ordered. Better then one second after which was very good too.
I've been a huge fan of d.j. molles since his books first came out and the survivalist series is right next to him now :) great story and I love how the characters constantly come together
The story grows. So does your need to follow how the characters working through all the problems the world is throwing at them.
Just finished this third one in the series.  The only bad part about that, is I have to wait til the summer for the fourth one!

This is not my first post appocolyptic series and these are a home run. I read these while recovering from surgery and as I read Coming home and Surviving home and got more than half way through the book I had Escaping home within arms reach and was glad I ordered all three at the same time. Does that answer any questions ? Some series fizzle out or flake out as they go but A. American kept the story believable and interesting . If you get one, get them all and hope what your reading stays fiction, and taking a few notes wouldn't hurt. I recommend reading these sooner than later.

Some people feel that this book left you hanging, I disagree. I feel the Author did his (or her) job and led you up to the point where society is now on its own to rebuild. Compared to his other two books yes this is different , because there is no next book. (for now I guess) But this was a great run, as my friend the surfer said, "ride the wave as long as you can". If you have read his other two books, then this is a no brainer, then buy it. If you are new to the series, read them in order. The Author does a great job in writing a preppy survivor series, and the main character (s) are the type of person I wish I could be in a widespread catastrophic disaster.
Really have enjoyed the series, wished I waited for the last one to come out before starting the series. Defintely recommended!

I really enjoy the series , easy to get into the characters mind set. I find that the story grabs you and  holds you , making it hard to put down. Can't wait ill the next one is avaiable. Great read and adventure

This is a very "realistic" view of what could happen.  It's not a "check out my gear" book, or so miltiaristic that I get lost in Ops Speak....  A really good story of what could possibly happen.  I am not sure that chaos would enuse and escalate as quickly as the author details, however, my only experiences come with hurricanes and not complete infrastructure failure such as an EMP.  I highly reccomend this and the other "home" books.  Good reads and kept me interested.  Looking forward to book 4

Book 3 in the series is setting things up well for Book 4. The relationships and characters are given more depth in this book, which I think will make the following book(s) even more exciting than the first ones, and that's saying something. The series gives us a glimpse of what post apocalyptic America could be like, and we are given an opportunity to become educated while also reading a riveting tale. Can't wait for the next book!

Great third book to the series.  My only gripe is that it is much shorter than the others and leaves a lot to be desired from the last book that comes out in July.  I hope A. American can really do a good job at closing this series.

Have enjoyed this series immensely.  The books are a fast read and find myself looking forward to bed time so I pick up reading where I left off.  Despite some grammatical errors,  would recommend for those whose like post apocalyptic reads.
A great series and given our current state of affairs very thought provoking. Went out and bought some spam and ammo yesterday. Enough said.
This entire series is remarkable. I have never been so drawn into a series of books before. The realism and accuracy is incredible. I truly hope there is more to come from this series.

Please look at Going Home and Surviving Home for previous comments.  Are all Americans created equal?  Not according to the Gov't Alphabet Soups agencies.  Some are more equal than others.  And who sees the big picture?  Those who prepare and those who took the Oath, for Liberty!

Everyone should read these books.  A lot of people think this cannot happen and the government will take care of everything.  The way things are going today anything can happen. Be prepared and start prepping now.

I really enjoyed the first two books in this series, but in this one the action was much slower and there was less of it, and it seemed like it was only half a book....the ending was very anticlimactic and the author picked a poor spot to end it.  I feel sort of cheated.  Not sure I will buy the next book.
Slowjacking the story to stretch it into more books...if the next one does the same I'm done. Too many good books out there and its a disappointment versus the first two of the series

Loved the first two books, but this one was leaving me wanting. Like the author ran out of ideas and needed to get something out there. The Kindle price rediculously high... It should of been $1.99 range. Sorry needs improvement.

Big Fan loved the first two, some of the best in PAW books.  The third book was pretty thin for a trade paperback price Tag, it really had no climax but in fashion was well written and continued the story in a way I liked it but slams you in the face with a "TO BE CONTINUED".  What I am pissed at is not the story it is the fact this book is barely 200 pages if it was a Paperback with standard print not Fat margin Twilight print pages, I really feel ripped off that I will have to buy the fourth book to complete the story, not a honorable publication plan by Penguin.
It's a fantastic series; I'm hooked!  I can't wait for the fourth novel.  Preppers vs. the DHS: The Ultimate Showdown!!

After reading "going home and surviving home" I was hoping to wrap it up but didn't know how the author was going to end it. Surprise, he didn't. The books have all been good though, and if next book is cheap I will definitely buy and read it. I'm glad I didn't have to buy War and Peace in 5 different books. Tolstoy may have left some money on the table, or just a good writer with end in mind.
Great story that continues to get better. Proof reading has improved, so mispelled words are less than usual. You will get invested in many of the characters.
Epic series! This one was a one day read. It quite simply could not be put down. Please write faster I want the next one!

A seamless continuation of the series, and a good read. As another reader wrote, you can see the author's growth as a writer, the stories keep getting tighter. My only complaint would be that it was too short. Way to go sir, keep up the good work.

I gave the first two books a five star rating because I loved them. This was a huge let down for me, like when a friend betrays you. I'm no longer a fan <sigh> and $5.12 poorer. Addendum: Amazon wanted me to add why I feel cheated. The first two books were like being served a 7 course meal that the host put their heart and soul into. The third one was like getting a piece of limp toast with a tad of butter smeared on it. When I got to the last page it was like, "what the heck?" It felt rushed and there was no solid story line.

i really like the guts and grit that it brings to the table. nothing is sugarcoated. the things that happen in these books may seemed far fetched  at first until you look at the big picture and what led up to the event. then its a hard realization of what could really happen

I so enjoyed getting back to these characters and this story. I had a hard time deciding between 3 or 4 stars but this one was not quite up to the level of the first two so my rating dropped to a 3 but I still enjoyed it in a different way than the others. All our regular gang are still here, though still not back together. Things switch between the guys & family, then we see what Jess is up to. This volume is not as action-happy as the previous two, there is still plenty of shoot 'em ups but there are definitely less than the norm. This left some periods where the story was all about talking about the next scheme or waiting for an episode to happen. What I can say though, is that this volume certainly improves on the character development of nearly every one of the major players. Thad had already been the most developed character and Morg too but we get to see a different side of Morg as he interacts with his family and we learn the different personalities of his three daughters. The soldier guys are all developed much further as well. I've really come to like this hodge-podge group of rough 'n' tough alpha males! The only one whose development was left out was Jeff. He's always there but I had to wrack my brain to recall how he came to be with these folks in the first place. Anyway great, fun series for those who like survivalationist themes.
I like the series. This group has a lot to deal with, but it is not to over the top as far as how they deal with it. It is a quick read, and i think for the money it is a solid choice.
I cant wait for the 4th book!  Very well written, good character building and exciting action!  i normally dont but i just had to buy the paperbacks after reading each on Kindle.
Love the series and it is great to escape into a good book when you can make the time. If you are interested in the genre, make the time. This series is fun to read.
I've read all three of this series and my ONLY complaint is the way they end and I have to wait months for the next installment.
Loved this next series in the lives of the characters. On Amazon now buying book 4, Forsaking Home, & can't wait to start it.

This book is not nearly as good as the first two installments. The action was scarce and the "how too" aspects of surviving the end of the world do not make for riveting reading. In spite of the author's obvious attempt to add dimension to the characters,  all he did was make them even more clichéd. Things that were annoying in the first two books are now outright bothersome. Constantly calling your youngest daughter Little Bit is not cute - it's trite and distracting. When real people speak to one another they use contraction's. They do not speak as if they are dictating their dialogue. The editing is bad and also distracting. Spell check doesn't supply the write word - it only spells the word rite. Wright? Constantly having to mentally correct grammar and syntax and having to guess what word the author meant to use is also distracting. Overall this was disappointing.
One of the best books of this type I have read. Purchased the second volume and am waiting for the third to be released.
I am enjoying the hell out of this book. A lot of folks are writing bad reviews about it. That's extremely ridiculous.
Scary interesting read and I pray this never comes to pass. Get ready for a shock when the lights go out.

I found this book more of a filler. The first two were very good and page turners, this one was more of a page skipper. So much useless details. The character Morgan become more of a side kick rather then the decision making no nonsense take action guy from the former novels.  I'm hoping this next book picks up the pace and more just to make up what this one lacked. You should still buy it because at least Jess and her part of this tale is still very dramatic and has the reader very much part of the goings on. Jesses saga got me to give this the three stars otherwise it would have been less.
This is just a fun read.  This was another good read in an excellent series.
If you are a fan of the genre than you have already read this.

The going home series by A. American is a must read for anyone interested in the survival genre of books. I started reading his first book on an internet forum, and his skills made it evident that he was a natural talent. His first book was a tough read with all the grammatical and spelling errors, but get through as it is worth it. The next books are much improved on the errors. This series has an excellent plot, excellent characters and is a very good read!
Best and most realalistic end of the world series out there.

I feel guilty for saying that this is the third of this guys books that I've read, and I can't explain why.  It's written for high school sophomores and is replete with juvenile vocabulary, misspellings, hideous grammar and repetitious phrases.  The plot, however, is very good, and it holds the readers attention like one of those old TV cliffhangers.  The characters are cartoon-like and shallow, and The dialog is unrealistic, simplistic and probably came from remnants found on the cutting room floor of Hee-Haw.  The only people in the book of decent moral character are the preppers. Everyone else is untrustworthy, dishonorable, stupid or out of touch. The author should have dictated the plot to someone with a modicum of writing talent and paid him to ghost-write the book.  I'm still trying to figure out why I read it.

I read all 5 books in 8 days, couldn't put them down. One night, I was reading book 3, thought it was around 9 pm, it was actually 12:50 am. We need to convince A. American to write faster. This was one of the best series I ever read. Having so many different stories going on at once, kept me glued to the book. Now that I'm finished, maybe I can go to bed at a decent hour now.
A fun informative read with useful information.

Not only is this guy growing better with each sequel, he's prolific.  While he is quite a billboard for a number of commercial products, he knows what he's talking about and has saved me a ton of shopping looking for the right bug out equipment.  For me , it's quickly on to book 4.
Time for the sheep to wake up, I am from Altoona FL. so this story really hits home. great series
This is a great series cannot wait for book 4 in 3  weeks!!  Hope everyone who likes these type of books reads this one

what can i really say here…its a continuation of the first book,if you liked the first one then you will like this installment…the pase of the book is good and it has good action threw out the book……the end is a real cliff hanger
this seres is excellent! aside from being frightenly possible , it also speaks to the  adventurer in your heart. You can't go wrong.
This is part 3 in the series and I can't wait for the 4th to come out. If your a prepper this series is for you period.
Could not put it down.  Look forward to hearing about the next chapter of Morg, Thad, Sarge and Jesse's lives.
Great series! I only wish they were longer because I am unable to put them down once I start reading. Great plot and character development as well as useful information for us prepper!
On the edge of my chair the whole time reading it.  I could not put it down.  I cannot wait until the next one comes out.
slow, boring. I used it to put me to sleep every night. not at all like the first books. pick it up A. American

In this third entry of the series A. American gives the reader an insight into the larger plans of the government and the current situation. The character building continues fleshing out people introduced in the first two books. Reality is setting in as the group's supplies start running out and they are forced to change their plans. Overall the third installment keeps the story moving forward and holds the readers interest. If you enjoyed the first two this one should not disappoint. However, there seemed to be a significant increase in grammatical errors as compared to the previous books. They are easily overlooked but worth noting.
Great story line.  Real life character's facing a changing world and finding a new normal in life. I enjoy the multiple story lines going at the same time and seeing the character's evolving.
Love the whole series. Can't wait for book 4 to come out. I have already pre - paid for it.

The story continues well if you like the characters.  As far as weaving survival education into the story the first book is the most thoughtful and should be read to stimulatetthought and emergency preparedness.

The first two books in this series were very very good and I guess it's difficult to maintain that level of excitement while writing.  The book was OK but definitely not up to par with the previous two.  The pages seemed to drag out and the characters just didn't seem to have the same vigor.  Had this been the first book, I probably would not have purchased the subsequent books.

Prepper fiction, I received the first book in the series for free. Both books to follow did not disappoint. If your s fan of Prepper fiction. this series and this book will be very enjoyable. Morgan just keeps getting into stuff and sarge and the other guys can't help but follow him into adventures

The author writes extremely well and develops his characters and story line to compliment each other.  You may not care for the genre, however if you like adventures, this author writes a very entertaining book.
This sequel was good, but not as good as the first book.  Hopefully the third installment will match the opener.

Scary because it could be our reality soon.  I keep more food in my pantry and water stored after reading this book. Educational as far as how people could react in such a short time if the lights went off
Third in the series and it's still great. Can't wait for the next one. Love this genre more than the zombie genre

This book continues on the series of surviving an EMP event in Florida. Good description of the Central Florida area. I enjoyed these books as they take place in an area I grew up in. They are also less violent than most post-apocalypse scenarios. Well written with characters you can get to know and like. Well developed story with some interesting subplots.

The series started with Going home. It was good and my review might have been a little over done, but I liked it and wanted you to get it.  I have tempered my reviews because let's face it, not all good books should rate a 5.  The author still has some room to grow but does a fine job relating the probable outcome of a collapse and what happens next.  He gives you more than one perspective on the outcome and does a good job of keeping it real.  None of us can tell the future and what it holds, but this book gives us a chance to look at one possible scenario.  The end is not really an end and that is a common issue with this genre, but I will buy the next installment as well. I recommend it.
After reading this my parents have come to realize the importance of fall back locations, means of travel, and companions you can count on and trust.  Very eye opening on all levels.
Home series by A.American has been a great find. Edge of your seat reading with awesome characters and wonderful storylines. Cant wait for next book to come out.

My husband and I have enjoyed all of the books in this series.  We have found them to be very informative and interesting.  They have given us food for thought.  We now travel with a go bag in every vehicle we have.  We have even given my mother a go bag.
I think if you've come this far in the series, you're in it for the long haul. I know I am!
Absolutely awesome. Can't wait for the next book keeps you reading and coming back for more. Which I can't wait for

I really liked the first book in the series dealing with an unknown EMP and trying to get home from a couple hundred miles away.  It was realistic (if one is a prepper) and has a ruck with him/her.  It was a pretty good teaching tool.  However, as the series progress, it becomes a morality tale of a purely evil government plotting to enslave the population.  This book also had the feel that it was rushed to the market to build on the success of the first one.  It does not have the care that I appreciated in the first of the series.

I Love love love this series.  If you like a good story about a what if scenario this book is for you.  Some stuff is a little bit political, but if you kind of get over that agenda the story is well written and entertaining.

Another good read in the survivalist series.  Several stories going on so you won't become bored.  The only thing I didn't care for in this one was it ended so abruptly, leaving all the stories sort of dangling.  Still worth the read if you like this kind of book.  I am sure the forth book in this series (when it is available in June, 2014 or so) will tie up all the loose ends.
I have read all of A. American's volumes to date and loved all of them.  "Escaping Home" is no exception.  Exciting, believable and hard to put down!
Well worth the six bucks. Might want to look elsewhere for tactics :-), but he should keep the series going.
If you ever decide to get a series of books this should be it. Honest,to the point and eye opening.

I am not a serious prepped but I do keep enough around to live 30 days after a disaster.  I have more ammo than food but I live in the country so ammo can get me food :) this book gets you thinking and is a very enjoyable read.
Just like then previous books this is one you just can't put it down only thing wrong with that is that it's a little short.
I really have enjoyed this series and am eagerly awaiting the next installment. Having several retired military men in our family, I particularly like the character of Sarge.

This is the first book in the series that I felt I didn't get my monies worth, and started to think that the author stretched this book out just to make more money! I expected it to have more of a conclusion even if the story continued. He took 324 pages to basically move them from the neighborhood to the cabins...yeah well I to found myself skimming through pages at times and I didn't in the first two books. There were more inconsistencies ... they are sure that Jess is in the camp at the beginning of the book and then don't seem to concerned enough to bring her up during the rest of rhe book. I felt that this was going to be the purpose of this book, reunite Jess with the rest of the book ... takun the camp down should have been the conclusion of this. The writing is really good and the story is there. I will probably hang in there for the next book but if it ends in the same manner this will be my last investment in this series!
Look for my review of the first book "Going Home" for all my review, but this is a great series!!!
I really liked the first book, it was very good. The next two books are a little redundant  and seem to drag on just a little to much.

Another great book in the series I can't wait for book four. This is a fast pace series with a lot of action and human relationships mixed in. The story is totally believable except that I used to work for DHS and I have a hard time believing that they are that tactical and ruthless. I hope this series keeps on going.

Counted down waiting for this books release and was NOT disappointed a bit.  Well written book that I could not put down!  I've pre ordered the next book the day I finished this one!  Thank you A. America .
Can't put down reading! If I did put it down I would pick it back up and eat an apple!
Just a further look into where we are headed if we the people don't get our act together and start standing up

I am not a avid reader but I am hooked on this series! Can't wait for the next one to come out. I would recommend you start from the beginning if you want to read them. They give many ideas on what you should stock up on and what is likely to happen if it ever happens!! I love it!!
The series just grows on you.  Has some blank spots but third book accumulates enough characters to help it along.  I recommend all three.  But only if you buy all three.
Left you hanging which is ok but seemed short compared to first two. Still like the author and the books. Will keep reading.
Amazing book that you will not to put down until you finish it. Can't wait fir volume 4 to come out.

Not only did I love this book, in spite of several typo's, but I loaned it  and the other two books in the series to my Step-son and his wife, and they both loved the entire series also. The last book seemed a little rushed, but regardless, I cannot wait for the next one in the series to find out what happens to the characters.
Series starting to get slow.  Was ready for it to end.  Thought this was the last but apparently not.  Story just ended.
This was a great story of survival I even got my wife to read them and she loved them also

Man A American can write.  These books are like an addiction.  The only bad part is when you get to the ends because there isn't another page to read.  I want more!!  Of all the WTSHTF authors this one is the best that I have found.

There's nothing to dislike... except maybe the DHS and FEMA camps, which holds true in real life. Again I have to say how much I love the character of Sarge with his "delightful" attitude. I look forward to book four.
A American keeps you interested in the story and the characters.  Looking forward to his forth book.  It should be just a good.
I have enjoyed this series and will continue to read it.  This is good postapocalyptic fiction. Read these in order though.
This is a great follow up to the first one. makes you think of what can happen if you plan only on staying in your current home. But what if you have to leave? This book makes you think....

I love these books by A. American as well as those by James Wesley Rawles, Glen Tate, and others. This was another enjoyable one. They are not only entertaining but they are equipment and tactic primers as well. This was another one I enjoyed.
waiting for fourth one to come out,have enjoyed all of the first three .Situations that are all possible with the way our country is headed
Liked the continued development of the characters. The story is believable, Can't wait to read the next one! I love Sarge!!
Really makes you think about something like this happening - well written - pretty scary though!!  Need to start prepping!

Can't wait for book 4.  Good character development.  Good story. Seems totally realistic, especially regarding the nasty side of many humans lying just under the thin vaneer of civility.  People hungry enough will become desparate enough to justify the worse conduct.
Very well written book that is hard to put down. This was a great continuation of the series, and I can't wait for more from this author!
Great story. Love the detail and the down to earth style. The characters and situations are Believable for a fiction.

ALL THREE IN SERIES HAVE BEEN GREAT READS.  A 'POST' SERIES THAT TIES FAMIY LIFE IN SUCH A TIME , THE GOOD AND THE TERRIBLE BAD THAT MIGHT BE IN SUCH TIMES.  GOOD PEOPLE HELPIN THEIR FRIENDS AND NEIGHB ORS  AGAINST THE BAD.  LOOKING FORWARD TO THE NEXT IN THE SERIES.
I have read each book in this series and they keep getting better. So much good information and believable characters. I have a hard time putting them down. Can't wait for the next one.
I LOVED THIS STORY CAN NOT WAIT FOR THE NEXT ONE. THIS IS A BURNER, GOT THROUGH IT ONE NIGHT.

I saw the reviews calling this edition of the series boring compared to the first two. I guess that's true if you want non-stop action. I thought it was a good insight into the everyday life post SHTF with issues like food, water and the basics to try to have some normalcy with your kids involved. I have really enjoyed the people from the first book being carried over through book three. Can't wait for the next one.

I guess starting out this book in the second of the series was not good.  For example how did these folks obtain heavy weapons, mortars,  Squad auto weapon (SAW)?.  The writing was juvenile.  Character development poor.  Not a helpful read at all.
A. American has done it again. He does a great job of keeping the characters real and consistent from book to book. Cant wait for the next one.

Enjoyed the series and looking forward to book four.  Not like other books of this style where these people are not awash in money and are like everyday people.  It is scary to think that such a thing could happen especially with our current administration.

This is the third book in a series. I read them all pretty quickly in sequence, took about a week. By this one, I could see where it was headed, and yes it ends by setting up the next book. Didn't learn as much from this one as the first two, but remained entertaining.
I love this series.  I do not seem to be able to put the book down.  Great reading!  Would suggest for ALL to read!

Escaping Home is a bit looser than the two previous books, but then that's not really all that uncommon.  My greatest dislike is the time involved in making the decision to leave "home".  The character development and situations with the wife and daughters needs to be more fully developed and more tightly edited.  I found myself wanting to smack these women for their failure to recognize the dangers lurking beyond their homes.....a little bit stupid.  My other criticism goes back to the need for good, solid editing.  There are too many typos and missing words.  It seems that I read somewhere that A. American had a new editor/proof reader for at least this third book....If that's the case, then yet another individual with a good red pen needs to be identified!  I passed the first book on to a family member who returned it saying, "I can't read it because of all the spelling and grammar errors."
Great book. I couldn't put it down. I highly recommend this book to everyone. I just wish there was more books I just wish there were more books in the series.
Not a very involved story.  No real ending, it was as if the writer just stopped writing.  Worst grammar I have ever seen in a published work.

I saw this series advertised in an outdoor magazine and thought I would give it a read.  Now I am hooked waiting for the next one.  I found the plot very intriguing and the ideas and gear brought out in the book new and interesting.  I would recommend this one and other books in this series.

Good stuff, worth the read and still enjoying the characters. The only thing is that it doesn't have the rawness and immediacy of the first book. That was something, wow! Plus I loved the year links. Those are missing here :( but still great story !!!

Well I got hooked on A. Americans writing style when I read the first one 'Goin Home'. His writing puts you inside the characters head and lets you know exactly what he's thinking . With action in every chapter and problems to solve , there's not too many dull moments in this whole series . If there's one part of this book that upset me ,because it took me from what the main characters were doing , it was the girls in the FEMA camp ! But I'm sure it will all tie in together in the next book 'Forsaking Home' ,which I'll be buying soon . I've bought about thirty 'Survival Books ' in the past year , (so many I have to re-read the start of each book to remember them!) But this series is right up there with 'One Second After'  or maybe better because that guy didn't prepare AT ALL ! Happy Reading !
Unique read on what could happen. Be prepared is my motto! Gives you something to think about and ponder. Semper Fi.

Just got done with the third book in the "Home" series.  "Escaping Home" was a great read.  Like the others, I couldn't put it down.  I'm not a lit major, so I could care less if there were some grammatical errors in the book.  Honestly, the story had me to interested to care.  I'm at the point now that I'm truly  concerned for Morgan and his group.  To me, any book that can pull me in like that deserves 5 stars!

This is an amazingly scary but informative series of survival when and IF the balloon goes up.  My hat off to A. American when is the fourth of this series coming out???  I can hardly wait to see what Morgan and gang will be facing.  I live (also) on the edge of Pisgah forest.

This has been an awesome series. One of the best fictional survival series that I have read! Excellent character development (much like Mathew Bracken's 'Enemies' series).Gosh, there has to be a 4th book coming!
The Survivalist Series of the three books in Excellent.  Once you start reading it's hard to put down. Order all three you'll not be disipointed.
Another great book! I read this one in a day and couldn't put it down. I already bought the next in the series (pre-order) which should be out in June I believe.
A great story of what may happen in our country in the future unless things change in our government.  A believable story of what may come
A good book with well developed characters and a good plot. I am enjoying this series though I'm missing women in the military or any positive positions of strength.
Great continuation of the story. I am looking forward to reading the next installment. Can't wait to find out what happens next.
Great book in the series on survival, during a post EMP power grab by the US government, and the actions taken to restore the nation to it's constitutional republic roots.
I can't wait for the next book. I hope they get to JessFred and get them out. Mary in my mind can stay she should have kept her mouth shut.
I've read all the books in the series to date, and enjoyed all of them. The story stays entertaining, and I can't wait for the next one.

A. American's ability to keep the reader turning pages seems to have improved with this book.  My only criticism is he quit to early leaving unfinished business when it comes to dealing with the government.  Hopefully he'll decide to do a fourth.
This is the second book in a series. I couldn't read it fast enough. Can't wait to read the third book coming out in April!

Even though it is unrealistic that a person would have so many preps and have them where he needs them at exactly the right time, it is still a good read. The book isn't finished yet.  I hope the author will continue to write and Finnish the story
I have enjoyed the Series and Look forward to each new installment, Great Books, Good Writing, Keeps you wanting more!!!
Read all the books in this series and can't put them down until I've read the last page.I'm  biting my nails waiting fir the next book.Would definitely recommend these books to anyone.

There is a ton of other stuff happening at the same time and some great characters as well. It's a great tale and I'm really looking forward to the next book.
Very enjoyable to read, kept my interest !! Good action and the store shows how it would effect a family.
I really enjoyed the well developed characters and story line.  Lets hope this story stays as fiction but I can't wait for a continuation to this series...

I really like this series,, I am hoping the next book is coming soon,, great read! very well written, check it out

I have bought the previous books of this trilogy. This was another great read from this author. I read this book in about three days and when I came to the end I was just dumbfounded that it was so short. I looked back and found this book is almost half as long as the other two books. Thinking about it, it just seems the author rushed it and just called it done when he got to a certain point. Overall good read, but grammatical errors and length of story were real turn offs. His writing and story telling abilities are on a par with Lamour or McMurtry.  I don't know if I could recommend them to women because I just don't know that many women that would enjoy them. I have really enjoyed the books by Angry American. I feel like I can relate being a husband and father and being in the military with time down range. His writing immerses you into the plot and his descriptions and details really paint a vivid picture for the reader. I especially like Sarge (not sure why the author doesn't refer to him as Top or First Sergeant but that little detail can be overlooked) and his crew and reminds me of my old favorite First Sergeant and a bunch of knuckleheads I've had the pleasure to work with over the years. Anyways it was a good read and I'm anxious to read the next book in the series. To the Author- Hurry Up!! Thanks for a good book. Two thumbs up!
Great book , I'm hooked on this series and can't wait to see what happens next. Will continue to read in the future.
I really enjoy this series of books the characters are interesting and the challenges they face make you wonder if we could  be facing this ourselves in the near future.
read the trilogy and found good information in them all. turned out to be a pretty good story as well.

As with all of the A.American books, this makes you think,what if..... Far and along,the best series in this Genre I have ever read. I hope the series never ends!
A great series! One thing I've always liked about his writing is how he develops characters.  I hope the next one is out soon! Moar Buk Now!
A must read for anyone who likes SHTF books. Lots of great ideas mixed into a good storyline. Finished this book and the next two in the series in a week. Couldn't put them down.

Great Series!  Great info and insight as to how things could play out in a SHTF world.  Being open to the possibility is only the beginning. Never the less, it is a great series.
I really enjoy reading this series and I can't wait for the next one!  This Authors vision of one possible future for us is right on the money I think!  Lots of great tips as well.

This is another great read from a very talented author. It lets us know whats happening to Jessica and her adventures are covered alongside the inevitable things that the folks close to Morgan find themselves facing. Thankfully the story ends with the door open for another great story.
A bit weaker than previous two books (mostly cause it's shorter), but still pretty good. Reintroduction of a certain character spiced up the storyline.

I was a little disappointed. I enjoyed the first one "Going Home" so much that I turned my coworkers and my father onto it. These are men that hardly ever read but they all agree that it was a book you couldn't put down. The second book wasn't as good but I was expecting more from this one and it let me down. But... I think the next book will be the best one yet!  Sarge is gonna open a can of ass whipping and Jess and the girls are gonna get out of that prison.
The story continues and I am hooked!  I wish there were 10 more books waiting in the wings to read.

Well thought out, well written. Great threading of multiple story lines throughout the series. Can't wait for the next book. This series and the Holding Their Own series are among the best in this genre.
where is the next book? Ya know, this is only gonna get better!  But you knew that, didnt ya?  Sincerely... just another window licking paste eater.

You like the genre or don't. I thoroughly enjoyed this sequel. Get it read it have fun, but start with the first book. I'm not a literary critic so grammer police and deep philosphers might disagree, but I look forward to the next one.
Love the characters in this book...at least most of them.  But I guess it wouldn't be a great book unless it showed the good and the bad that will come out in a SHTF situation.
Left me wanting more. Hope the next book is coming soon. This book would not stand alone as a novel due to the abrupt ending.
amazing story. kept me wanting more.  really wanted to read all day long an found myself mentally putting my self in the book.
Well developed characters, good writing. Would like more info on armed services reaction to political coup and DHS. What about delta?

I've read a ton of this type of story and this series is one of the best.  A. American doesn't waste time with long descriptions of characters...no, he gets right to it.  He also has a way of telling you what's happening so well, you can instantly picture it all in your miund. I bought all three books at once and finished them way too fast.  I hope there are more to come as the story is just getting better and better.

Most of the time I leave the book reviews to the pros, but I got to step up here and tell the readers about this series by A. AMERICAN. This is not your normal apocalyptic novel.  I've read a library full of  those things; from Zombies, to Global Warming, to invasion, to nuclear disaster, etc. etc...but this guy does something that all the others lack: True survival situation tactics. As I've said before I am not a Prepper, or Anarchist, I just like the escapism of these types of books, but A. Americans' books really made me think; what if this kind of stuff really does happen. Just the fact that the author had me really nervous and thinking seriously about the "Doomsday" scenario gives credence to his writing skills.  Which is good of course, but the WAY he went about it was by being almost fanatical in the details. About how, and what it would take to truly survive such a situation. It was almost like an instruction manual with a story thrown in for good measure! As far as I know, these are the only books written by this author (unless he's using a pseudonym) and I can't wait for the next book to come out! Everyone should read these novels because of the education factor. That way if the day does come, you won't be so taken by surprise as things progress from bad, to worse, to unspeakably horrid.
Loved this book. It is well written as were the two books preceeding this one, Going Home and Surviving Home. A believable survivalist novel. Keep them coming please!
Great character developments and story line!  I truly hope there will be a fourth book!  Definitely a very fast read!
Continuing story and a good story line that just keeps you wanting more. Can't wait till the next one comes out.
Great book, it is entertaining and realistic.  It keeps the reader engaged and provides useful lessons in everyday life.  Keep up the good work!
All three were page turners. Very entertaining!!! I hope there are more coming..lots of things left hanging in this one...
Another great read in this series.  I can't wait for the rest of the series to be published.  Keep up the great work!
Good story line. Love the character development in this series. You actually feel for them. Nice change from the "cookie cutter" prepper/survivalist books that have flooded the market.
Great book. Just like the rest I the series I couldn't put it down. You will not be disappointed. Start with book one and you will be hooked.
I thought it picked up right where the second book left off. The characters were just like running into old friends. Please hurry and get the next book out.

I really have enjoyed this series and look forward to the next installment! I have been reading quite a bit of post apocalyptic fiction and this series is in my top 5.  I have also learned a lot and have started my own bug out bag! Keep the books coming!

Can't wait for the next book to come out. I love the way the author makes the characters so believable. Great story.
I just love this series!!!! If you like this kind of genre you really have to check this series  out!

Continuing the story with all the characters we find that home is not where you live but what you make it. Lots of adventures and truths reveiled about the government camps. All these winers about it not being broken into a perfect ending can eat it, because not all endings are perfect and sometimes you are left hanging.
A. American can't publish books fast enough for me and my father.  Excellent series that I hope never ends!!! Keep up the amazing writing!

I downgrade this to 4 stars for one simple reason:  It ends in a way that leaves a lot of things dangling, with no visible evidence that other installments are in the works. But still, I enjoyed the book although I don't think I'll do the next in the series if it appears.

With the way the world is looking today you have to wonder if A American has a time machine to see in to the future! Book 3 keeps up the pace and leaves you craving more.
I have read a lot of survival books. This series I really enjoy, it's not filled with ridiculous scenarios but with real life action!

This book was FANTASTIC! The tactical and survival information was spot on, and the action kept me on the edge of my seat. The book covers the reality of violence and defending your self and your family, as well as natural human reactions to such things. I think it could have done without the cursing, but I can live with it. Outstanding job.

From the get go, I felt like I was part of the group, trying to survive and thrive. I'm a Army Vet and miss the brotherhood that Sarge, Mike, Ted and Doc show towards each other. The constant picking on each other is our way of caring. Thanks for a great book. Keep up the amazing work and God bless. There wasn't ANY dislike in this book.

Couldn't put this book down. Read it in one day and need more! I am not a literary critic so no notes on writing styles or typographical errors, I just enjoy these books and can relate with the main character in the story. It also helps that I agree with much of the authors thoughts on the human condition.

As I mentioned in my other reviews, I think the story line is very informative.  I believe the story is more factual than fiction.  I believe this can happen anytime to us.  Definitely gives insight as to how things might be in the future!  We should all take note & definitely prepare for the worst!

This is the third in the Series and I can't wait to start #4. I feel like I'm walking in their shoes and wondering what is around the next bend. I read 5 to 6 books at a time, but I just seem to fall back to this series because I want to see how each character reacts to all the different situations.

Some stated that this wasn't as exciting as the first two installments. I disagree with their assessment. A American knows how to ebb and flow the narrative. If you want continuous, disjointed, over-the-top action, Dolph Lungren has some dvds for sale at your local flea market.

Just finished the last of the four novels.  Highly enjoyable throughout all four books.  I definitely recommend the series.  You quickly become attached to the characters and the story holds your interest as you follow them through the beginning of a collapse of society event.

I really enjoyed this novel. I have come to enjoy all the later books in the series much more than the first. The main character isn't some hero who can do anything. He's a regular guy who has some useful knowledge and supportive and helpful friends and family. Great read.

Read it in one day! I could not put it down! Looking forward to the next one! What is going to happen next to Morgan and Mel and the girls! Love Thad and now that Jess is back in the picture how is she going to get reunited with Morgan and Thad and Sarge of course!!!

Some of the most enjoyable survivalist/prepper fiction I've read.  Not as much political commentary as most which is a nice break.  Also great for me as it's set in Central Florida(where I live) and accurately portrays the locations and local details.

I like the characters. Good story. The only thing that bothers me is all prepper novels end with type of big battle as the climax. Not sure it would play out like that in the real world but I can't really think of a better way to end a book or series.

Zipped through it on vacation, and im gonna start "foresaken Home" on the plane ride back. Love this series what a great read! I have them all on my kindle app and i feel like a hypocrite, im gonna need to order them on paper back.

Have this whole series and even though no post apocalyptic sequel is as good as the first one this series has kept my interest. One before this one was not up to par but author has gotten back to his original style and this was good read.

This book. The series in fact is just utterly amazing. I can't bring myself to put it down. I read this book in one sitting and completely forgot about the real world. A.American is just a captivating author and I never want it to end.

This third installment in the story line was a total waste of time. Nothing of note takes place, no furthering of the story line.  Action is very minimal. Found myself skipping through multiple pages looking for something of interest.

As far as survival series go, this one is awesome. Fictional situations are paired with real life survival skills and equipment suggestions. The characters by this book are well formed and I look forward to reading what happens next.

I started this series by reading "Going Home", I am still reading the entire series. Usually I only read a couple in a series but got caught up with this group of people and want to know how they manage during the disaster.

This series is great.I've been a fan of A. American for a long time. I started reading him a year ago on  survivalist board.com. and followed him on my kindle the series is worth every penny.keep up the good work A American.

Very enjoyable read. Not quite as good as the first book in the series or  but very entertaining and readable. As one of a series of book it is a must read to keep up with the characters of the first book.
This is a great book. The series started off a little slow for me, but quickly picked up and I couldn't wait to get the others. The books do need to be read in order to follow the storyline though.
A friend recommended this series to me and once I started reading I could not stop. Great characters. I live in the area the book takes you through and all of the places are spot on. Great books!!
This series started as interesting, then things started getting twisted and now I am hooked.  I really want to know how the characters are going to get out of this mess.  On to the next one....

I am a 30 year old city girl who accidentally discovered these books and I can't put them down. I even got my brother, dad and boyfriend into them. If they can entice me, they are great reads! The characters are fulfilling and the plot line is definitely not boring.
This is a good story, good characters, good sequel to the past two stores. It just has the same editing problem, poor grammar, missing & misused words, all little things but very distracting.
I am not sure that this is the way things will happen with Obamas administration but it sure is possible..  It was a good read. Some grammar problems and some errors but kept my interest.
Excellent read, based on what could happen in the future, a must read series for many Americans!! Especially for those who are asleep at the wheel and think things are just hunky dory.

Very fun read, I'm enjoying the whole series. With the exception of some foul language these are great. Good thought provoking read for opening the eyes of friends or family.

It's official. I'm hooked. I don't usually write reviews, but with this series I felt compelled. After reading Going Home and Surviving Home I was eager to get my hands on this little gem Escaping Home. I have been raving about these books since I finished the first book in the series late last year. I have thoroughly enjoyed all of them. Rich character development throughout. A story that progresses in a manner that is as engaging as it is exciting. I only wish the next book in this series was in my hands NOW. I rarely keep books after I've read them. I donate them or give them to friends. I will be keeping these. There is no doubt I will re read them. I highly recommend the entire Survivalist Series by A. American.

Read all of the books in this series up to and including Escaping Home.  I was very disappointed and will not finish the series (I'm assuming there is more) because Escaping Home was so ridiculous in so many ways!  It reads like a YA book except for the language which did not bother me, but the silliness and stupidity of the adults in this book certainly did.  Parents intentionally taking their children into incredibly dangerous situations when they could have easily left them out of it! WHAT???  No parents that I know would even dream of this!  Not to mention the abusive and disrespectful ways animals and fish were treated unnecessarily by adults and children!  Enough already, no more thank you not very much A American.  This could have been a good book, but apparently the author didn't take into consideration the intellect of the reader.

The book and the story are great and deserve 5 stars.  I can't wait to READ the rest of the series. HOWEVER, the narrator ruins it.  I'm just in the second half of the book and so far, I've counted SEVEN mispronunciations of places in Florida.  For example, the narrator pronounces Ocala as if it sounds like Ocola.  Wait until you hear him pronounce Alachua or Steinhatchee. There is no excuse for this.  All this lazy buffoon had to do was look up the pronunciation on the internet.  Duke Fontaine's rank incompetence ruins the experience of listening to a book with an underlying theme the self reliant rugged individualist vs. the unproductive needy collectivist with Fontaine clearly demonstrating his membership in the latter category.  If this guy worked for me, he would have been fired on the first day of the job.  Perhaps he should read Atlas Shrugged before he narrates another book.

This was a very good sequel to the previous 2 books.  I have very much enjoyed them, and this book tells the story of what might happen to a family who thought that everything would now be fine, after surviving to get home after a world changing event. But even after being reunited, and with the family stocked up as much as possible, the family must deal with the aftermath. Can't wait for the next one.
